item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "All families are psychotic. Everybody has basically the same family - it's just reconfigured slightly different from one to the next." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "...blame is just a lazy person's way of making sense of chaos. " -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Mothers are all slightly insane." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by J.D. Salinger
Chelsea add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Certain things, they should stay the way they are. You ought to be able to stick them in one of those big glass cases and just leave them alone." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "This was not a good idea coming home for Christmas. I'm too old. Years ago, coming back from schools or trips, I always expected some sort of new perspective or fresh insight about the family on returning. That doesn't happen anymore-the days of revelation about my parents, at least, are over... its time to move on. I think we'd all appreciate that." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "At least there's nothing scary about him and hopefully he doesn't see anything scary in me. We go way back, to summer camp. We KNOW each other. People I don't know just make me want to say YIKES! I'll take history over mystery any day of the week." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "...a habit that had become one of those necessary things for the night... surely a body-friendly if not familiar-lying next to you. Someone whose touch is a reassurance, not an affront or a nuissance. Whose heavy breathing neither enrages nor discusts you, but amuses you like that of a cherished pet." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "I think of how the person who needs the other person the least in a relationship is the stronger member." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "You have to take risks, he said. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen. Every day, God gives us the sun--and also one moment in which we have the ability to change everything that makes us unhappy. Every day, we try to pretend that we haven't perceived that moment, that it doesn't exist--that today is the same as yesterday and will be the same as tomorrow. But if people really pay attention to their everyday lives, they will discover that magic moment. It may arrive in the instant when we are doing something mundane, like putting our front-door key in the lock; it may lie hidden in the quiet that follows the lunch hour or in the thousand and one things that all seem the same to us. But that moment exists--a moment when all the power of the stars becomes a part of us and enables us to perform miracles." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "We are visitors on this planet. We are here for one hundred years at the very most. During that period we must try to do something good, something useful, with our lives. if you contribute to other people's happiness, you will find the true meaning of life." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Theresa Rebeck
item.description: "I may be a slut, but I'm a slut who is growing a conscience." -- Theresa Rebeck

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Paris is the only city in the world where starving to death is still considered an art." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon
